Heimlich Maneuver – Sitting Victim

In partial obstruction of the airway, the Heimlich maneuver may be performed up to 5 times, alternating with 5 hard thumps between the shoulder blades. This procedure is continued until the obstruction is relieved or the victim loses consciousness. In case of loss of consciousness, resuscitation is recommended.

The Heimlich maneuver with alternating thumps should be used in cases of total or near-total closure of the airway, whose features include:

  • Inability to breathe and panicking
  • Inaudible breathing
  • Ineffective cough
  • Inability to speak

These actions may be performed on children aged 1 year and above, with the applied force adjusted according to the victim’s physique.
